member.name: O:Page::Microsoft#Foundation#AuditCodes#Source Code Setup
member.summary: Source codes are used to categorize the source of a transaction.
member.remarks: This page is used to set up source codes that are used to categorize the source of a transaction. Each feature that introduces a new transaction source should add a field to set up a default source code.

member.name: O:Table::Microsoft#Foundation#AuditCodes#Source Code Setup
member.summary: Source codes are used to categorize the source of a transaction.
member.remarks: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/business-central/finance-setup-trail-codes This page is used to set up source codes that are used to categorize the source of a transaction. Each feature that introduces a new transaction source should add a field to set up a default source code.

member.name: F:Table::Microsoft#Foundation#AuditCodes#Source Code Setup.Primary Key[10]
member.summary: The primary key field of the setup record. A blank is used as default.

member.name: O:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch
member.summary: Provides an interface for interacting with number series. This codeunit batches requests until SaveState() is called. For more direct database interactions, see codeunit "No. Series".

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.GetNextNo(Code[20]):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the next number in the No. Series. This function finds the first valid No. Series line based on WorkDate and calls the No. Series Line implementation to get the next number. Defaults UsageDate to WorkDate.
member.param: Code for the No. Series.
member.returns: The next number in the series.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.GetNextNo(Code[20],Date):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the next number in the No. Series. This function finds the first valid No. Series line based on UsageDate and calls the No. Series Line implementation to get the next number.
member.param: Code for the No. Series.
The date of retrieval, this will influence which line is used.
member.returns: The next number in the series.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.GetNextNo(No# Series Line@,Date):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the next number in the No. Series. This function uses the specified No. Series line and calls the No. Series Line implementation to get the next number.
member.remark: The caller is responsible for providing an up to date Line.
member.param: The No. Series line to use.
The last date used, this will influence which line is used.
member.returns: The next number in the series.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.GetNextNo(Code[20],Date,Boolean):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the next number in the No. Series. This function finds the first valid No. Series line based on UsageDate and calls the No. Series Line implementation to get the next number.
member.param: Code for the No. Series.
The date of retrieval, this will influence which line is used.
Whether errors should be ignored.
member.returns: The next number in the series, if HideErrorsAndWarnings is true and errors occur, a blank code is returned.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.GetNextNo(No# Series Line@,Date,Boolean):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the next number in the No. Series. This function uses the specified No. Series line and calls the No. Series Line implementation to get the next number.
member.remark: The caller is responsible for providing an up to date Line.
member.param: The No. Series line to use.
The date of retrieval, this will influence which line is used.
Whether errors should be ignored.
member.returns: The next number in the series, if HideErrorsAndWarnings is true and errors occur, a blank code is returned.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.PeekNextNo(Code[20]):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the next number in the No. Series, without incrementing the number. This function finds the first valid No. Series line based on WorkDate and calls the No. Series Line implementation to peek the next number. Defaults UsageDate to WorkDate.
member.param: Code for the No. Series.
member.returns: The next number in the series.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.PeekNextNo(Code[20],Date):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the next number in the No. Series, without incrementing the number. This function finds the first valid No. Series line based on UsageDate and calls the No. Series Line implementation to peek the next number.
member.param: Code for the No. Series.
The date of retrieval, this will influence which line is used.
member.returns: The next number in the series.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.PeekNextNo(No# Series Line,Date):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the next number in the No. Series, without incrementing the number. This function uses the specified No. Series line and calls the No. Series Line implementation to peek the next number.
member.param: The No. Series line to use.
The date of retrieval, this will influence which line is used.
member.returns: The next number in the series.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.GetLastNoUsed(Code[20]):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the last number used in the No. Series.
member.remark: If a line was just closed, this function will return an empty string. Please use the NoSeriesLine overload to get the Last number for closed lines.
member.param: Code for the No. Series.
member.returns: The last number used in the series.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.GetLastNoUsed(No# Series Line@):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the last number used in the No. Series.
member.param: The No. Series line to use.
member.returns: The last number used in the series.

member.summary: Verifies that the No. Series allows using manual numbers.

member.summary: Verifies that the No. Series allows using manual numbers and throws an error for the document no. if it does not.

member.summary: Simulate the specified No. Series at the specified date starting with the indicated number.

member.summary: Puts the codeunit in simulation mode which disables the ability to save state.

member.summary: Save the state of the No. Series Line to the database.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Batch.SaveState
member.summary: Save all changes to the database.

member.name: O:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#Cross-Company No# Series
member.summary: Provides an interface for interacting with Tenant No. Series. These No. Series are cross-company and used for cross-company functionality For per-company functionality, see No. Series.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#Cross-Company No# Series.CreateNoSeries(Code[10],Text[50],Code[10])
member.summary: Creates a new cross-company No. Series
member.param: The new No. Series code.
The new No. Series description.
The last used number from the No. Series. The first number retrieved will be this number increased by one.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#Cross-Company No# Series.GetNextNo(No# Series Tenant):Code[20]
member.summary: Gets the next available number for the given cross-company No. Series
member.param: The No. Series to get the next number from.
member.returns: The next number.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#Cross-Company No# Series.GetNextNo(Code[10]):Code[20]
member.summary: Gets the next available number for the given cross-company No. Series
member.param: Code for the No. Series Tenant to use.
member.returns: The next number.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#Cross-Company No# Series.Exists(Code[10]):Boolean
member.summary: Checks if the given cross-company No. Series exists
member.param: Code for the No. Series Tenant to use.
member.returns: Whether the No. Series exist.

member.name: O:Table::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series Tenant
member.summary: Table that contains the available Tenant No. Series and their properties. These No. Series are used for functionality cross-company, for numbers per company, see No. Series.

member.name: O:TableExtension::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#NoSeriesLineObsolete
member.summary: This object contains the obsoleted elements of the "No. Series" table.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#NoSeriesManagement.RaiseObsoleteOnBeforeGetNextNo(No# Series Line@,Date,Boolean,Code[20]@,Boolean@)
member.summary: This method is added for compatibility only.It raises the obsolete OnBeforeGetNextNo event.
member.remarks: There's a bit of a symantic change with this event. You can no longer change things like ModifySeries, UsageDate, SeriesCode using this event Also, the line record passed is no longer the line from the previous call as that data is not kept anymore in regular scenarios.
member.param: The "Series Code" field is taken from this line on input. If handled, then the actual line used is returned in this parameter.
The date on which to get a number.
Specifies whether the line should be modified.
The new number from the specified series.
Specifies whether a subscriber handled the event.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#NoSeriesManagement.DoGetNextNo(Code[20],Date,Boolean,Boolean):Code[20]
member.summary: Gets the next number in a number series. If ModifySeries is set to true, the number series is incremented when getting the next number.
member.remark: If you set ModifySeries to false you should manually increment the number series to ensure consistency.
member.param: The identifier of the number series.
The date of the number series. The default date is WorkDate.
Set to true to increment the number series when getting the next number. Set to false if you want to manually increment the number series.
Set to true to disable errors and warnings.
member.returns: The next number in the number series.

member.name: O:TableExtension::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#NoSeriesObsolete
member.summary: This object contains the obsoleted elements of the "No. Series" table.

member.name: O:Table::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series
member.summary: Table that contains the available No. Series and their properties.

member.name: O:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Setup
member.summary: Provides helper methods used in the setup of No. Series and No. Series lines.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Setup.CalculateOpen(No# Series Line):Boolean
member.summary: Verifies the state of a line and returns whether or not the line is open and can be used to generate a new No.
member.param: the No. Series Line to verify.
member.returns: Returns true if the line is open, false if the line is closed.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Setup.IncrementNoText(Code[20],Integer):Code[20]
member.summary: Increments the given No. by the specified Increment.
member.param: The number, as a code string to increment
Indicates by how much to increment the No.
member.returns: The incremented No.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Setup.UpdateNoSeriesLine(No# Series Line@,Code[20],Text[100])
member.summary: Updates the different No. fields in the No. Series Line based on the pattern provided in the NewNo parameter.
member.param: The No. Series Line to update.
The new No. used as template to update the fields.
The caption of the field the NewNo was entered in.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series.IsNoSeriesInDateOrder(No# Series):Boolean
member.summary: Returns true if the number series has Date Order set.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series.OnAfterSetNoSeriesCurrentLineFilters(No# Series,No# Series Line@,Boolean)
member.summary: Use this event to change the filters set on the No. Series Line record. These filters are used when viewing the No. Series page and when drilling down from a No. Series record.

The No. Series Line to set filters on.
Specifies whether the filters are being set for a drill down.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series.OnSetNoSeriesLineFilters(No# Series Line@)
member.summary: Use this event to set additional filters on the No. Series Line record. These filters are used when searching the No. Series.
member.remarks: Changing the filter on the "Series Code" field is not allowed and will result in an error.
member.param: The No. Series Line to set filters on.

member.name: O:Enum::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series Implementation
member.summary: Specifies the possible No. Series implementations.

member.name: E:Enum::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series Implementation.Normal
member.summary: Specifies the standard No. Series implementation, which updates the database on every call and uses the table to keep state.

member.name: E:Enum::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series Implementation.Sequence
member.summary: Specifies the sequence No. Series implementation that does not update the database on every call and uses database sequences to keep state.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Sequence Impl#.GetNextNo(No# Series Line@,Date,Boolean):Code[20]
member.remarks: Whenever the Last Date Used Changes, the No. Series Line will be modified. The UpdateLock is only set in cases where the No. Series Line will be modified. The "Temp Current Sequence No." must be preserved in case we use UpdLock as the Find() will reset it.

member.name: O:Interface::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Single
member.summary: Specifies the interface for No. Series implementations.

member.name: M:Interface::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Single.PeekNextNo(No# Series Line,Date):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the next number in the No. Series, without incrementing the number.
member.param: The No. Series line to use.
The date of retrieval, this will influence which line is used.
member.returns: The next number in the series.

member.name: M:Interface::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Single.GetNextNo(No# Series Line@,Date,Boolean):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the next number in the No. Series.
member.param: The No. Series line to use.
The date of retrieval, this will influence which line is used.
Whether errors should be ignored.
member.returns: The next number in the series, if HideErrorsAndWarnings is true and errors occur, a blank code is returned.

member.name: M:Interface::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Single.GetLastNoUsed(No# Series Line):Code[20]
member.summary: Get the last number used in the No. Series.
member.param: The No. Series line to use.
member.returns: The last number used in the series.

member.name: M:Interface::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series - Single.MayProduceGaps:Boolean
member.summary: Specifies whether the implementation may produce gaps in the No. Series. For some business scenarios it is important that the No. Series does not produce gaps. This procedure is used to verify that does not happen.
member.returns: Whether it is possible that the implementation will produce gaps.

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series Cop# Add Intent.Build(JsonObject@):Dictionary of [Text,Integer]
member.summary: Build the prompts for generating new number series.
member.param: Function Arguments retrieved from LLM
member.remarks: This function is used to build the prompts for generating new number series. The prompts are built based on the tables and patterns specified in the input. If no tables are specified, all tables with number series are used. If no patterns are specified, default patterns are used. In case number of tables can't be pasted in one prompt, due to token limits, function chunk result into several messages, that need to be called separately

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series Cop# Change Intent.Build(JsonObject@):Dictionary of [Text,Integer]
member.summary: Build the prompts for modifying existing number series.
member.param: Function Arguments retrieved from LLM
member.remarks: This function is used to build the prompts for modifying existing series. The prompts are built based on the tables and patterns specified in the input. Tables should be specified. If no patterns are specified, default patterns are used. In case number of tables can't be pasted in one prompt, due to token limits, function chunk result into several messages, that need to be called separately

member.name: M:Codeunit::Microsoft#Foundation#NoSeries#No# Series Text Match Impl#.CalculateStringNearness(Text,Text,Integer,Integer):Integer
member.summary: Computes a nearness score between strings. Nearness is based on repeatedly finding longest common substrings. Substring matches below Threshold are not considered. Normalizing factor is the max value returned by this procedure.
member.param: First string to match
Second string to match
Substring matches below Threshold are not considered
Max value returned by this procedure
member.returns: A number between 0 and NormalizingFactor, representing how much of the strings was matched
